benchmark_details.name: KBL (Korean Benchmark for Legal Language Understanding)
benchmark_details.overview: KBL is a benchmark for assessing the Korean legal language understanding of large language models. It consists of 7 legal knowledge tasks (510 examples), 4 legal reasoning tasks (288 examples), and the Korean bar exam (4 domains, 53 tasks, 2,510 examples).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of KBL is to evaluate the performance of large language models in understanding and processing Korean legal language across various tasks.

data.source: The datasets were compiled using various sources, including Korean precedents, statutes, and legal QA datasets.
data.annotation: The datasets were developed in close collaboration with lawyers to ensure quality assurance.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the correctness of model responses to the tasks.
methodology.interpretation: High accuracy indicates better understanding and reasoning capabilities in legal contexts.
methodology.validation: The tasks were verified by licensed lawyers to ensure the quality and relevance of the questions.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All personal information is redacted by the Korean government or court.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Datasets will be released under a CC BY-NC license.
